meanings.definition: To spend more money than is available or than is considered appropriate.
meanings.sent1: I always overspend on snacks when I go grocery shopping.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overspend during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: My friend joked that I could overspend even in a dollar store.
meanings.sent4: Trying to impress others, he would overspend on unnecessary luxuries.
meanings.sent5: The young couple learned a tough lesson after they overspent on their vacation.

meanings.definition: The act of spending more money than is available or than is considered appropriate.
meanings.sent1: Overspend can lead to financial difficulties if not managed properly.
meanings.sent2: The overspend on the project caused delays in its completion.
meanings.sent3: The company's overspend on office supplies raised some eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The overspend in the budget was a topic of discussion at the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The overspend highlighted the need for better financial planning.
